Data: Starc to Guptill, no run length ball outside off, left alone. A Test-like start to the final of 2015
Starc to Guptill, 1 run short of a length, on off, he opens the face to guide it to third man for one

Starc to McCullum, no run perfect first ball. Starc has brought it. Full, just outside off at 149ks, McCullum drives, but is beaten on the inside edge. Misses the off stump by six inches. Great start from Starc
Starc to McCullum, no run McCullum gives him the charge, Starc stays full, follows him as he backs away. No room, swinging in, beats him

Starc to McCullum, OUT Timbahhhhhhh. Starc you beauty. What a ripper [in Bill Lawry voice]. What an occasion. What a start. He bowls it full, he swings it in, he lands it between the stumps and the popping crease. McCullum is tentative for once. The bat comes down late. Off stump is set back. Starc goes away on a celebratory run. MCG is on its feet. The game is not over obviously, but Starc... how is that for a start?
Starc to Williamson, no run more swing, more pace. Some dip on it. Williamson is hit on the pad, but the ball is headed down leg
Hazlewood to Guptill, 1 run short of a length, on the pads, worked around the corner
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run more swing. Another outswinger. Left alone outside off
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run short of a length, outside off, gets chest high. Williamson thinks of playing at it, but leaves it alone late. Nerves there
Hazlewood to Williamson, 4 leg byes strays onto the pads, Williamson misses out on the flick, but gets four leg-byes for it
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run full, just outside off, slight swing away, defended off the front foot
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run on a length, in the tentative channel outside off, left alone

Starc to Guptill, no run more swing for Starc. That has dipped back in, Guptill seems trapped in front, but Guptill has got an inside edge onto the pad. The lbw shout is big, but they decide not to review it
Starc to Guptill, no run short of a length. First signs the ball might not come? Guptill looks to work this to leg, but he has to wait for it, and in the end he defends it back
Starc to Guptill, no run on a length, on off, defended from the crease
Starc to Guptill, FOUR runs wide half-volley, Guptill plays a classy square-drive. In front of point, all along the ground. First boundary off the bat
Starc to Guptill, no run bouncer this time, and a pretty sharp one. Pitches middle and off, and angles away. Guptill sways out of its line
Starc to Guptill, 1 run on the pads this time, and he has helped it around the corner for one
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run wide length ball, holds its line, left alone
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run short of a length, wide, punched away, but can't pierce the gap at point. Smith and Warner nearly collide as both are eager to get to the ball. Warner fields this one
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run slight nip back in from a tight off-stump channel. Defended off the front foot

Hazlewood to Guptill, SIX runs good sharp bouncer, and he has top-edged it for a six. That points to the pace, all right, but also how much the ropes have pulled in. This is not a full-blooded hook. Guptill is cramped for room with this bouncer so he hardly can swing properly, but the top edge flies over Haddin's head for six #MCGsobig
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run shoulders arms to one outside off
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
Starc to Williamson, no run half-forward to defend this length ball
Starc to Williamson, no run on a length, slight shape back in, but not too straight. Flicked towards mid-on
Starc to Williamson, no run tentative from Kool Kane. Short of a length, on off, angling away, he is late into trying to punch this. Beaten
Starc to Williamson, no run beats the bat again. Starc is on fire here. Short of a length again, on off, Williamson plays at it too, and is beaten by the angle
Starc to Williamson, no run digs this in short, stays on off with the natural angle. Williamson goes low and sways out of its line

Starc to Williamson, 1 run Williamson is so lucky here. Follows a wide length ball. Doesn't drive at it powerfully. Just a nothing tentative push. The ball, though, has flown off the thick edge, and over backward point. Third man comes around to field
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run outswinger, on a length, outside off, left alone
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run on a length, angling in, beats the inside edge, but is headed down leg
Hazlewood to Williamson, 1 run on a length, opens the face late on it, gets a thick edge to third man for one
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run short of a length, holds its line a little, defended to leg
Hazlewood to Guptill, 1 run holds its line just outside off, takes a thick edge for a single to third man
Hazlewood to Williamson, 2 runs overpitches a little, strays a little, first confident stroke from Williamson as he clips this past square leg for two
Starc to Guptill, 1 wide bouncer, too short, too high, called a wide

Starc to Guptill, no run this ball is too good. Almost unplayable. This is shaping to swing in, Guptill is playing for it, just outside off, but the ball pitches and seams away. Beats the edge. Another day he might have edged this
Starc to Guptill, no run angling away this time, and Guptill doesn't play at it
Starc to Guptill, no run short of a length, angling away from just outside off. Another leave

Starc to Guptill, no run full and straight after having pushed it across with the angle. Guptill plays around his pad, but this is full and he makes good connection. A dive at short midwicket saves runs
Starc to Guptill, no run again short of a length, on off, allowed to angle through to the keeper
Starc to Guptill, no run bouncer again, this time it is head high, and Guptill ducks under it
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run short of a length, just outside off, holds its line slightly, beats the outside edge as he pushes at it
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run on a length, nipping in a little, defended off the back foot
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run on a length, angling in, nicely clipped away, but can't beat mid-on

Hazlewood to Williamson, no run that's a sharp short ball. This has come out of nowhere, and has kicked off from just short of a length. Gets shoulder high, nips back a little. Williamson thinks ramp, and pulls out at the last moment as it has got too big on him
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run on a length, angling in towards top of off, defended to mid-off
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run short of a length, seaming in, beats the inside edge to hit the pad and end a maiden

Johnson to Guptill, no run that's a sharp first ball. It is nasty. From the low round-arm release, from just short of a length, it rises towards the chest. Guptill throws his gloves up in defence. Lucky it hasn't lobbed up
Johnson to Guptill, no run again that awkward short-of-a-length delivery that is rising into the chest. Guptill is off his feet to get on top of the bounce as he fends
Johnson to Guptill, no run fuller, pitches middle, holds its line, defends off the back foot
Johnson to Guptill, no run stays back to punch this length ball to mid-off
Johnson to Guptill, 1 wide wide down the leg side this time. Gets the line a tad wrong. Bowled at 146ks
Johnson to Guptill, no run on a length, on off, defended off the back foot. This is 148ks
Johnson to Guptill, no run short of a length, no room, punched to cover

Hazlewood to Williamson, no run on a length, just outside off, he leans into it and punches this back at Hazlewood who sticks a hand out, which ends up deflecting this into Guptill at the non-striker's end
Hazlewood to Williamson, FOUR runs mid-off is wide, and he has exploited that gap. This is a length ball outside off, he pushes it on the up, and sort of punches it straight of that man for four
Hazlewood to Williamson, 2 runs digs this one in short, around chest high, and Williamson gets on top of the bounce, and rolls the wrists on the pull. Left of long leg it goes
Hazlewood to Williamson, 1 run short of a length, wide, he opens the face on it, gets a single to third man
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run half-volley on off, driven hard down the ground, but straight back at Hazlewood
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run short of a length, just outside off, good bounce, and Guptill is off his feet as he defends
Johnson to Williamson, no run sharp bouncer, on middle and leg, at 147ks, Williamson gets inside the line to look to hook, but bails out at the last moment as he realises this has got big on him
Johnson to Williamson, no run short of a length, at the hip, Williamson manages to keep it down with his defence
Johnson to Williamson, no run that is beautiful. That's an offcutter at close to 150ks. Un. Play. Able. On a length, pretty quick, on off, he has to play at it. And it cuts away to beat him
Johnson to Williamson, no run another beauty. Johnson is on today. Just a bit of that offcut again as he pitches on a length at off, and then leaves him to beat the bat
Johnson to Williamson, 1 run the rare half-volley, pushed away to deep cover this time
Johnson to Guptill, 1 run on a length, at the pads, worked away for a single to long leg
Maxwell to Guptill, no run he has bowled short and wide, but so far have New Zealand been pushed back that he has cut this straight to cover point

Maxwell to Guptill, OUT what a bowling change. And how much has that miss on that half tracker played on Guptill's mind. Stays back to a ball slightly short than good length. He goes back to play for the offbreak and punch it. The ball turns, but not as much as he is expecting it to. Hits the top of off. Big Show on Big Stage. Also Haddin gets in Guptill's face with his applauding gloves to leave a sour note on what has been Australia's afternoon
Maxwell to Taylor, FOUR runs full toss first ball, great welcome for Taylor, he drives this past cover for four
Maxwell to Taylor, no run defends a full ball
Maxwell to Taylor, 1 run turning into the pads, worked around the corner for one
Maxwell to Williamson, no run half-volley outside off, lovely drive against the turn, but can't get past the diving man at cover
Johnson to Taylor, 1 run tucked away off the hip for a single

Johnson to Williamson, OUT Johnson has looked like getting a wicket nearly every ball, and he has done so now. He has bowled excellently. His pace and aggression so far means any slight misbehaviour off the pitch is going to have a big impact. This is a length ball, around that middle and off channel. Previously balls have cut and fizzed away, this stops a touch. Only a touch, mind you. Williamson is early in defending, and lobs this back to Johnson. He is looking to work this to leg, but this has also angled away towards off, which means he has checked his shot a little
Johnson to Elliott, 1 run runs this down to third man for one
Johnson to Taylor, no run short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
Johnson to Taylor, 1 run full, fast and wide, Taylor drives sqyares, Warner misfields at point, contains a single
Johnson to Elliott, no run offcutter outside off, Elliott is drawn into a defensive shot, and is beaten
Hazlewood to Taylor, no run full ball, overpitched, middle and leg, driven down the ground, but can't beat mid-on
Hazlewood to Taylor, no run short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
Hazlewood to Taylor, no run short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
Hazlewood to Taylor, no run full, outside off, defended off the front foot
Hazlewood to Taylor, no run short of a length, outside off, he is forward to defend
Hazlewood to Taylor, no run wide length ball, it holds its line, and Taylor plays at it on the walk. Well away from the body. Beaten

Johnson to Elliott, no run this is absolutely excellent from Johnson. Bouncer from only short of a length. As in this is not dug in halfway down but has gone up higher than the shoulder. He has swayed out of it
Johnson to Elliott, no run full outside off now, defended
Johnson to Elliott, 1 run full, on off, defended off the front foot, in front of point, gets a single
Johnson to Taylor, 3 runs full and wide. A half-volley. Taylor leans into it, push-drives it past cover
Johnson to Elliott, no run bouncer, pretty quick, 148ks, at the stumps. He ducks under it
Johnson to Elliott, 2 runs full this time, outside off, Elliott - despite those two bouncers - is looking to move forward, and pushes this wide of cover
Hazlewood to Taylor, no run short of a length, outside off, gets good bounce, Taylor is off his feet as he defends
Hazlewood to Taylor, no run fuller, outside off, holds its line, hits the outside half of the bat as he defends
Hazlewood to Taylor, 3 runs nice shot. This is a length ball on off, he shuffles across the line to work this past midwicket
Hazlewood to Elliott, 1 run shuffles across to a wide length ball to run it down to third man for one
Hazlewood to Taylor, no run short of a length, outside off, defends
Hazlewood to Taylor, no run on a length, on off, defended towards mid-on
Faulkner to Elliott, 1 run short of a length, on off, he opens the face and runs this down to third man
Faulkner to Taylor, no run full, outside off, defended off the back foot
Faulkner to Taylor, 1 run moves across the line get inside the line of this length ball and works this to long leg for one
Faulkner to Elliott, 1 run shuffles across and drops this length ball into the leg side for one
Faulkner to Taylor, no run shuffles across to a length ball, defends it back to him
Faulkner to Taylor, no run low full toss, flicked back to him
Maxwell to Elliott, 1 run wide half-volley, driven to deep cover for one
Maxwell to Taylor, 2 runs low full toss, Taylor moves across to paddle this fine of fine leg. Taylor has looked on and busy today
Maxwell to Taylor, no run stays back to a length ball and punches it to cover
Maxwell to Taylor, 1 run half-volley, driven to long-on for one
Maxwell to Elliott, no run nicely bowled. Attacking line outside off, the ball dips on him, meaning he is not close to the pitch of the ball. Beaten on the outside edge
Maxwell to Elliott, 1 run wide length ball, pushed against the turn, gets a single
Faulkner to Elliott, no run half-volley outside off, driven nicely, straight to short cover
Faulkner to Elliott, 2 runs wide length ball, driven with an open face, through point, comes back for two by the time third man comes around
Faulkner to Elliott, 1 run full, pushed to mid-off, who is back at the 30-yard ring. Gets a single
Faulkner to Taylor, no run on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
Faulkner to Taylor, no run full, on off, pushed to mid-on, who is tight on the single
Faulkner to Taylor, no run on a length, outside off, hit straight to mid-off
Maxwell to Elliott, 2 runs reverse-paddle from just outside off, past short third man. He has not bothered to turn the face of the bat. Has played it off the back of the bat
Maxwell to Elliott, no run defended to leg
Maxwell to Elliott, 1 run looks for the late cut, gets a bottom edge for one
Maxwell to Taylor, no run turning into the pads, defended to leg
Maxwell to Taylor, 1 run paddles this full ball away fine

Maxwell to Elliott, no run Maxwell has got another. Big Show owning the big day. But Taylor suggests to him this could be bouncing over so they have reviewed this lbw decision. Elliott is beaten on the sweep. The ball has pitched outside off, turns in, goes under the bat, and hits him on the knee roll. Taylor seems to suggest it is going over, but the replay and Hawkeye suggest it is missing leg with the turn. Dharmasena will have to overturn his decision. Phew. That seems like a gamble that has paid off for New Zealand. This was a review in hope. A mini little clinching of fists from
Starc to Taylor, no run short of a length, on off, he is on his toes to defend
Starc to Taylor, 1 leg bye hit on the pad as he is beaten by the pace, but this has pitched outside leg
Starc to Elliott, no run full outside off, dug out towards cover
Starc to Elliott, no run loose drive. This is on a length, angling away. He is neither close to the pitch of the ball, nor the line of it. Beaten. Loose and uncharacteristic shot
Starc to Elliott, 3 runs this is better from Elliott. He moves across the line to get close to this length ball, and pushes this wide of mid-off
Starc to Taylor, no run uppishly pushed to mid-off, but well short of that man
Maxwell to Elliott, FOUR runs short, not too wide, but he makes room to cut it past point for four
Maxwell to Elliott, 1 run down the wicket to push this down the ground for one
Maxwell to Taylor, no run turning into the pads, defended to leg
Maxwell to Taylor, no run flighted just outside off, defended back to him
Maxwell to Taylor, 1 run plays his favoured paddle sweep for one
Maxwell to Elliott, 1 run length-ball offbreak, worked away for one
Starc to Elliott, no run on a length, on off, defended with an open face
Starc to Elliott, no run short of a length, outside off, looks for a cut, gets a bottom edge, Haddin flies to his left to save a few runs here. Lovely take
Starc to Elliott, no run yorker this time, Elliott equal to it. Keeps this down
Starc to Elliott, SIX runs second top-edged six. #MCGsobig #Batedgesobig. Again this short ball gets a bit big on him, Elliott is cramped, doesn
Starc to Elliott, no run lovely yorker again. On the crease, in front of middle. He has just about got the bat down in time
Starc to Elliott, no run length ball angling away, left alone
Faulkner to Taylor, no run on a length, around off, he moves across to defend this to leg
Faulkner to Taylor, 1 run full outside off, pushed to the right of mid-off for one
Faulkner to Elliott, no run short of a length, just outside off, opens the face, can't get this past backward point

Faulkner to Elliott, FOUR runs lovely shot. Elliott is looking good now. That extra cover seems to be his preferred area. Full, outside off, he stays beside the line and chips it over extra cover. Good to watch
Faulkner to Elliott, 1 run runs this length ball to third man to bring the fifty for the partnership
Faulkner to Taylor, no run he has moved too far across, is hit on the pad smack in front of middle stump, but the ball is clearly pitched outside leg. Another good save to his left by Haddin
Watson to Elliott, no run short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
Watson to Elliott, no run on a length, middle and off, defended off the front foot
Watson to Elliott, no run short of a length, on off, he shuffles across to work this to leg, but can
Watson to Elliott, 2 runs short of a length, wide, punched away square of deep cover. Starc makes a diving save
Watson to Elliott, no run short of a length, on off, he tries to stay beside the line, opens the face, but can't get beat point
Watson to Elliott, 2 runs short of a length, wide, he deliberately plays it over point for a single
Faulkner to Taylor, 1 run wide length ball, driven to deep cover for one
Faulkner to Elliott, no run on a length, outside off, pushed with an open face, but can't beat the man at point
Faulkner to Elliott, FOUR runs half-volley, outside off, he has played an excellent shot. Driving it through cover. Between mid-off and extra cover. All along the ground
Faulkner to Elliott, no run good change-up. Short of a length, extra bounce with an offcutter slower ball. Beats the bat as it leaves him off the pitch
Faulkner to Elliott, 1 run short of a length, outside off, opens the face, gets a single to third man
Faulkner to Taylor, no run short of a length, no room, he cuts, but finds backward point
Watson to Elliott, no run on a length, on off, pushed back to him
Watson to Elliott, 1 run short of a length, on the stumps, and he backs away to run this down to third man for one

Watson to Taylor, FOUR runs draws the edge but New Zealand have had a partnership going, which means there is no slip[ in place. He pushes at a length ball outside off, the ball holds its line, takes the outside edge, and goes through the vacant slip region
Watson to Taylor, no run on a length, outside off, he shuffles across to defend it back to him
Watson to Taylor, 1 wide bouncer, but too short and too high. Called a wide
Watson to Taylor, 1 run short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
Watson to Elliott, 2 runs hard drive at a wide length ball, gets a thick outside edge. Third man is a little square, but he does well with that dive to save two runs
Maxwell to Taylor, 1 run full outside off, paddles this fine of fine leg for one
Maxwell to Elliott, 1 run opens the face on a length ball, gets a single to the left of short third man
Maxwell to Taylor, 1 run full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
Maxwell to Elliott, 1 run pushed down the ground for one
Maxwell to Taylor, 1 wide fired into the pads, a wide down the leg side
Maxwell to Taylor, 1 run tossed up outside off, pushed to long-off for one

Maxwell to Elliott, 1 run tossed up wide outside off, slower through the air, Elliott is looking for the chip over cover, but the ball arrives late, and the bat face turns in his hand. He is lucky this mis-hit hasn't carried to long-off. That brings up the fifty for Elliott. Is he doing what Warne did in 1999 World Cup? Elliott was also the top-scorer in NZ's successful chase the last time New Zealand played at MCG
Johnson to Elliott, 1 leg bye short of a length, pitched outside leg, hits him on the thigh pad. Concedes a leg-bye
Johnson to Taylor, no run short of a length, middle and off, moves across to defend this back to him
Johnson to Taylor, no run short of a length, outside off, leaves alone this offcutter. Bounces in front of the keeper
Johnson to Taylor, no run full, tailing back in a little, solidly defended back to him
Johnson to Taylor, 1 run length ball outside off, slight offcut on it, Taylor gets behind the line and opens the face to get a single to third man
Johnson to Elliott, 1 run full and wide, he wants the cover-drive, but gets a thick edge to third man
Maxwell to Elliott, no run tossed up outside off, pushed against the turn, but not past cover
Maxwell to Elliott, 2 runs down the wicket flick this length ball into the leg side. They get two before the deep fielder can come in #MCGreallysobig

Maxwell to Elliott, no run lovely delivery. Tossed up outside off, dips on him, has created the gap between his body and the pitch off the ball. Elliott ends up pushing at it. The ball doesn't turn. Beats the outside edge
Maxwell to Elliott, 1 run half-volley this time. Driven to long-off for one
Maxwell to Taylor, no run full, into the pads, can't beat short midwicket
Maxwell to Taylor, no run flighted outside off, drags him across. Taylor defends this back to him
Johnson to Vettori, no run floats a length ball outside off, beats Vettori's attempt to open the face late
Johnson to Vettori, 1 run shuffles across, Johnson stays outside of, he is not behind the line, gets just the single to mid-on
Johnson to Elliott, no run length ball, outside off, he opens the face, but Clarke is superb here. He has positioned himself at slip. Fields this to his right
Johnson to Elliott, no run short of a length, stays a touch low, punches this to cover
Johnson to Elliott, 1 run drives on the up, goes square, to the left of point, Smith makes a diving save, but they take a single off the deflection

Johnson to Vettori, OUT this is top-quality bowling from Australia. Johnson has come back to completely outdo Vettori. Full inswinging yorker at a high pace. Off the round arm it comes, dipping on him, tailing back in, Vettori is late on it, is beaten on the inside edge, is hit on the pad, and the deflection rattles the stumps
Faulkner to Elliott, FOUR runs short, into the body, a rare loose ball from Australia. This is short, not even chest high, and at Faulkner's pace. So he pulls it over midwicket for four
Faulkner to Elliott, no run slower legcutter, beats his inside edge and also does him in for pace. Hits him on the thigh pad but this is headed down leg
Faulkner to Elliott, no run looks to stay beside the line, opens the face on a length ball, finds point
Faulkner to Elliott, no run short of a length, outside off, pushed with an open face

Faulkner to Elliott, OUT Faulkner has brought that one final big wicket. Slower ball does it again. It is so hard to pick because it comes out with the seam up. Elliot sees a length ball that he can hit over the leg side, but he is way too early into the shot. He gets the outside edge, and Faulkner's back-of-the-hand slower ball always bounces extra, which means it carries to Haddin for yet another catch. Australia all over New Zealand. A bit of a send-off again, but he gets a generous applause from the full house. raises his bat to them
Faulkner to Henry, no run yorker on off, he does well to get the bat down in time

Johnson to Southee, SIX runs Sixer Southee has hit a six first ball he faces. First intentional six of the innings/ #MCGsobig. Johnson bowls the slower ball, on a length, and he gets under it to loft it over long-on for a biggie
Johnson to Southee, no run shuffles across to defend a full fast delivery
Johnson to Southee, 1 run clears the front leg to drive this length ball to long-on
Johnson to Henry, no run bouncer now. Won't be many slower balls around after that six first ball. He has to rush out of its line to protect his head
Johnson to Henry, no run full and straight, he backs away to drive, but finds mid-off
Johnson to Henry, no run sharp bouncer again, and no room either. He has to sway out of its line
Faulkner to Southee, no run normal pace, length ball, angling in, squeezes under his bat
Faulkner to Southee, no run short of a length, angling in, backs away to defend
Faulkner to Southee, no run short of a length, angling in, he makes room, but can't beat point with his open-face shot
Faulkner to Southee, no run slower legcutter, Southee is done in, and it follows him to beat the back-away-and-swing
Faulkner to Southee, 3 runs this time Southee is expecting the slower ball, and makes room to chip this length ball over extra cover
Faulkner to Henry, no run drives on the up, hits the length ball straight to cover
Johnson to Southee, no run he shuffles across to look to help a short ball to fine leg. He has guessed right, in that the ball is short, but he has been beaten by the pace
Johnson to Southee, no run full and straight, makes room to hit this to extra cover. Won't get a single
Johnson to Southee, 1 run slower ball, offcutter, he mis-hits it to long-on
Johnson to Henry, no run short of a length, he backs away and hits, and is beaten by the angle

Johnson to Henry, OUT oh that is not the intention but they have got the wicket all the same. This is a yorker gone wrong. A low juicy full toss outside off with all the off-side fielders in the ring. Henry drives, but neither gets power behind it nor manages to keep it down. Easy catch for Starc at cover-point
Johnson to Boult, 1 wide tries a bouncer but is way down the leg side. Called a wide

Johnson to Boult, OUT this could be sensational. It is actually sensation regardless of the result actually. Short of a length, at the hip, defended to short leg, and Maxwell spots from the corner of his eye that Southee is a little lazy getting back into the crease at the non-striker's end. He lets rip a throw at the non-striker's end. Southee has barely a foot to go back, but Maxwell's throw has beaten him. Southee's bat has got stuck in the ground. Sensational run-out. Sums up Australia in the field today

It is not all over yet. They still need to score these runs off. In the previous match between New Zealand and Australia, 150 was almost defended. New Zealand won't give up just yet. They have come so far playing attractive aggressive cricket. No reason to not continue with it in this one final effort. You will have top join Alan Gardner to see if New Zealand can conjure something here. This is Sidharth Monga ending his World Cup. Been a pleasure bringing it to you

Australia lost the toss on a flat MCG pitch, which has resulted in scores of 300 every match and easy defence of those totals. What do they do? Mitchell Starc first bowled an excellent first spell, including yorking Brendon McCullum and bowling him out for a duck in the first over. Josh Hazlewood continued doing his best impression of Glenn McGrath, and Mitchell Johnson brought more pressure with his pace and aggression at first change. Grant Elliott and Ross Taylor then put together a partnership, took New Zealand into the Powerplay only three down, but that's when they ran into Australia's

5.57pm What a top-dog effort from Australia. They have now taken 79 of the 80 wickets available to them. While it will be pointed out that New Zealand's score is the same as India's in the 1983 final, I am sure Australia would have taken this at the start of the game
Right now, they don't need to open their mouths. Pointing at the scoreboard will do. If they close this out - as they should - then there'll be no quibbling about who are the rightful champions.

Out charge the Black Caps, back into the arena. And here come Finch and Warner, like a couple of Reservoir Dogs - they look like they mean business. The G is resplendent. It is draped in green and gold right now but they'll be black and blue all over if New Zealand manage to cause an upset.
Tim Southee is at the top of his mark, David Warner on strike... Two slips and a gully
Southee to Warner, no run starts on a good length, around the line of middle and off, shapes back a fraction as Warner blocks from the crease
Southee to Warner, 1 run slightly shorter and on the legs, stays back and flicks the first run of the innings down to fine leg
Southee to Finch, no run in the channel, not doing much through the air or off the pitch, Finch gets a stride in and shoulders arms
Southee to Finch, no run goes a little wider and angles this in towards off stump, holds its line, defended on the front foot
Southee to Finch, no run beaten! Moral victory to Southee - whatever that counts for - as Finch is drawn into pushing at one in the corridor
Southee to Finch, no run testing line from Southee, Finch has not been in the pink for a few weeks now, hangs his bat out but once again manages to keep it inside the line
Boult to Warner, no run sends this down on a length outside off and Warner has a flash, zips past the edge, definitely some shape there
Boult to Warner, no run in the corridor, trying to draw Warner out, doesn't bother with the feet and throws the hands, another play and miss! Swinging for both of them
Boult to Warner, 1 run pitched up on the stumps, not quite a yorker, tucked into the leg side for a single
Boult to Smith, no run full and around off stump to begin with to the new man, shuffles across and defends
Boult to Smith, no run nicely timed but his punch coming forwards rolls to the man at cover
Southee to Warner, no run on the stumps, good length and Warner tucks the ball towards midwicket, throw comes in as he returns to his crease
Southee to Warner, 2 runs little bit of width, fired across the left-hander and Warner chops a couple through point
Southee to Warner, 2 runs touch straight from Southee, this is flicked off the pads down to fine leg, where Vettori fields
Southee to Warner, 2 runs timing from Warner, he's going to be busy today, unless New Zealand can give him an early finish. Closes the face and punches a fullish ball back past the bowler
Southee to Warner, no run slightly full and outside the line of off, can't get this one away
Southee to Warner, 1 run pitched up, gets forward and dabs another quick single down the ground
Boult to Warner, 2 runs angled in with the arm, Warner hops back and tucks another couple off his hips in front of square
Boult to Warner, no run slightly back of a length, over the stumps and Warner tries to hoick it to leg, hits the splice and falls towards short midwicket
Boult to Warner, FOUR runs full outside off, Warner is on the walk, spanks a lovely cover drive for the first boundary of the innings
Boult to Warner, no run sprays this towards leg stump but it just begins to come back at the batsman, stabbed to mid-on
Boult to Warner, no run pitched up on middle and leg, defended to the on side from back in the crease

Boult to Warner, 3 leg byes length but veering towards leg, Boult striving a touch, you feel, Warner flicks it off his hips and they get three as Henry slides on the boundary at fine leg. Australia's dynamo keeps the strike
Southee to Warner, FOUR runs width, the ball isn't coming back in for Southee, Warner opens his shoulders and slaps another rasping drive through the covers
Southee to Warner, FOUR runs short now, kerplunked into the air... but it clears mid-on! Back-to-back boundaries for Warner, not the cleanest connection but it ran away

Southee to Warner, FOUR runs edged and wide of the sole catcher! What are the chances... no sooner has McCullum gone a touch more defensive, Southee draws an edge, Warner driving at a full ball but it was out of reach of the diving Taylor
Southee to Warner, 1 run length delivery, punched into the off side for a quick single
Southee to Smith, 1 wide outside off, shapes away, too far
Southee to Smith, no run goes across and is happy to leave a length ball outside off
Southee to Smith, 1 run straighter line, Smith works the ball off his pads for a single to midwicket
Boult to Smith, no run slips in the full ball on off, not quite a yorker, Smith is watchful enough to keep it out without drama
Boult to Smith, no run full and straight again, Smith reaches in front of his pad to check-drive back to mid-on
Boult to Smith, no run pitched up on the stumps and again Smith lines it up in defence
Boult to Smith, no run full and in the channel, shuffles across and mistimes a punch into the covers
Boult to Smith, FOUR runs put away! Boult drops short and Smith rocks back and dispatches this to the square leg boundary, lazy pull shot, in the old style
Boult to Smith, 1 run length in the channel, comes forward and drops one into a gap in front of square
Vettori to Smith, no run flighted outside off, Smith skips out to it and drives firmly to mid-on
Vettori to Smith, no run flatter and a touch straighter, stays on off stump and turns short to the on side
Vettori to Smith, 3 runs pushed through outside off stump and Smith sways back, guides a cut between two fielders, won't quite go all the way
Vettori to Warner, no run tossed up on leg stump, Warner gets down late and shovels a sweep to backward square leg
Vettori to Warner, no run flatter, quicker and again flicked around the corner to the man at 45
Vettori to Warner, no run comes forward and taps this into the covers
Boult to Smith, no run goes around the wicket, digs this in short and Smith goes across to block on off stump
Boult to Smith, 2 runs stroked through the covers, slightly full from Boult, the ball no longer moving and driven coming forwards
Boult to Smith, 1 run angled in, gets forward and taps one more in front of square
Boult to Warner, no run back over the wicket, good length and holding its line, defended in front of the wicket
Boult to Warner, 1 run drifts on to the pads and Warner clips between midwicket and mid-on for a single
Boult to Smith, no run around the wicket, length around the line of off, Smith gets in line

Henry to Warner, FOUR runs starts with a long hop and Warner has pulled this in the air, yards wide of Anderson at fine leg! Continues to throw the kitchen sink, this was top-edged but nearly went all the way, landed in front of the rope as the fielder realised he wasn't going to make it
Henry to Warner, no run pitched up and this time slapped hard into the covers, straight to the fielder otherwise that was four more
Henry to Warner, no run slighlty full, comes forward and pushes into the off side
Henry to Warner, no run full again, inviting the drive, punches this into the hands of short extra cover
Henry to Warner, no run Henry has found his line, pitched up a little further, blocked back towards the bowler
Henry to Warner, no run tight line on off stump, finishes the over well as Warner dabs towards short extra cover
Boult to Smith, no run length ball, around the line of off stump, goes back and across to defend
Boult to Smith, 1 run drops back in the crease and glides a single down to third man
Boult to Warner, FOUR runs overpitched and creamed through the covers, Warner is racing towards the line. Brings the hands through so fast, piercing the gap

Boult to Warner, no run misses this and struck on the back pad! Boult's arms goes up but he then realises it was probably sliding by... Dharmasena thinks the same. Warner fell over that delivery, heart would have been pounding for a moment
Boult to Warner, 2 runs short and in the channel, sits back and uppercuts wide of third man, who gets around to cut it off
Boult to Warner, no run goes across and defends around the line of off
Henry to Smith, no run around the line of off, defended
Henry to Smith, no run slightly back of a length, Smith blocks back to the bowler from in front of off
Henry to Smith, 1 run fuller length, shuffles across and pushes towards mid-on, they run one to the fielder
Henry to Warner, no run touch short and sliding across the left-hander, 140kph and blocked into the ground towards short extra cover
Henry to Warner, no run length on the stumps, punched into the ground and Henry grabs it in his follow through
Henry to Warner, 1 run continues around the line of off, decent pace from Henry, worked off the pads into a gap at midwicket
Boult to Warner, no run slightly short of a length, around the line of off, played into tthe ground
Boult to Warner, no run in the channel, tries to play from the crease but mistimes it, rolls back down the track
Boult to Warner, no run shortish and Warner is perilously close to playing on! Stayed back and hung out a horizontal bat, the thick bottom edge cannoned down wide of the stumps

Boult to Warner, no run half an appeal, again for lbw! Boult again thinks it was going down the leg side, no inside edge on the replay - Warner again stuck on the crease. Hawk-Eye suggests it would have shaved leg, umpire's call
Boult to Warner, 1 run drops back and dabs a length ball into the covers to steal one
Boult to Smith, no run fired across the right-hander from over the wicket, gets in line and defends with soft hands
Henry to Warner, FOUR runs cracked off the middle of the bat, Warner swats a short ball through square leg! Another boundary for the Warner dream-killing machine
Henry to Clarke, no run Henry continues to pound the pitch, Clarke walks across and stands tall to defend
Henry to Clarke, no run tight line around off stump, covers his stumps and defends solidly
Henry to Clarke, no run length in the channel, no deviation off the deck, Clarke blocks again
Henry to Clarke, no run pitched up a little further, outside off but tailing back in dangerously. Well judged by Clarke as he offer no shot
Boult to Smith, no run full and around off, shaping back a touch as Smith plays it moving across his stumps
Boult to Smith, 1 run length delivery on middle and off, tucked short into the leg side and they jog one
Boult to Clarke, no run fired across the bows outside off, Clarke happy to watch that by as he gets comfortable in the middle

Boult to Clarke, 3 runs leading edge, flies through the covers, NZ hands on heads! The ball was sliding across Clarke and he closed the face on it, a low chance flew between the two men stationed there by B-Mac
Boult to Smith, 1 run bouncer from Boult, gets up sharply but Smith keeps on top of it and tucks one towards midwicket
Boult to Clarke, no run fullish on off stump, Clarke drops his bat on it

Henry to Smith, no run he's hit the stumps but the bails have stayed on! To be honest, the ball only trickled on to the wicket but still... Smith played back to a length ball, got an inside edge on to his pads and then whirled around to see he was okay
Henry to Smith, no run goes across and defends solidly this time
Henry to Smith, 1 run on the stumps, length delivery, walks to the off side and tucks to leg
Henry to Clarke, no run pitched up around the line of off, Clarke leans into a forward defensive
Henry to Clarke, no run length around off stump, comes forward and taps into the covers
Henry to Clarke, no run fullish, holding his line in the channel, Clarke again sits in his crease watchfully and blocks
Southee to Smith, 1 run slightly back of a length, Smith waits for it and tucks one more to leg
Southee to Clarke, no run pitched up outside off, presses forward and pushes along the ground to mid-off
Southee to Clarke, 1 wide Clarke backs away and Southee fires it down wide of the stumps... called wide but that looked marginal
Southee to Clarke, 1 wide slams in a fiery bouncer, Clarke flinches as it climbs through - too high, this time
Southee to Clarke, 1 run punched to the left of mid-on and Clarke gets off strike, he was hanging back and didn't hit it cleanly
Southee to Smith, no run fullish, shuffles across his stumps and defends
Southee to Smith, no run Southee pitches on a good length outside off, Smith gets in line and plays softly in front of square
Southee to Smith, 1 run in the corridor, slightly shorter, goes back and runs another single off the face down to third man
Henry to Smith, 1 run length ball around the line of off stump, Smith nonchalantly tucks it into the leg side for one more
Henry to Clarke, no run pitched up in the channel outside off, Clarke is not being tempted by those yet
Henry to Clarke, 1 wide steams in and bangs the ball in very short, clearly they're trying to get Clarke a-swaying and a-creaking. Too high again, though
Henry to Clarke, no run back of a length, over the stumps, defends form the crease
Henry to Clarke, no run tight line around off stump, Clarke sits back and chops into the ground, rolls towards backward point
Henry to Clarke, no run short and climbing at the batsman, better directed from Henry, Clarke squares up and presents his bat like a shield
Henry to Clarke, no run on the stumps, played back with a closed face towards mid-on
Southee to Smith, no run goes around the wicket to change the angle, full length around off stump, Smith digs it out
Southee to Smith, 1 run Smiffy shuffles to the leg side, lights his pipe, tucks the morning paper under his arm and paddles one more through midwicket
Southee to Clarke, no run back over the wicket, pitched up and blocked around off stump
Southee to Clarke, FOUR runs fullish, width and Clarke bites this time, carves a thick outside edge high towards third man... No one out there, of course, and it bounces away to the rope
Southee to Clarke, no run slips this is very full, homing on off stump, Clarke reacts quickly and manages to squeeze it out
Southee to Clarke, 2 runs drops short, nasty line of attack and Clarke half-pulls, half-jerks, sends the ball safely down and away through square for a couple
Henry to Smith, 3 runs lovely stroke from Smith, fraction overpitched by Henry and he plants the front foot, picks a gap in the covers
Henry to Clarke, no run Clarke on strike, so here's the short ball, drops back to defends
Henry to Clarke, no run full and wide of the stumps this time, mistimes a drive coming forwards
Henry to Clarke, FOUR runs flashes and flashes hard, a healthy top edge flies over the cordon, it was a bit too close to cut but he got away with it

Henry to Clarke, FOUR runs another hair-raising boundary for Clarke, just beyond the fingertips of gully! Wasn't to the pitch but drove hard at a full ball in the channel, the edge whirred past the horizontal Williamson, I think, in an instant. Would have been another worldie but, then, we've come to expect them from NZ
Henry to Clarke, 1 run short of a length, over the stumps, drops back and nurdles one to the leg side
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run tossed up on the stumps and pushed towards mid-on
Vettori to Smith, 1 run gives this some air, dipping towards middle and leg, Smith uses his feet and whips the ball through square
Vettori to Clarke, no run length outside off, Clarke lets it come on to the bat, defends to short extra cover
Vettori to Clarke, no run tossed up and driven into the covers coming forwards
Vettori to Clarke, no run tight line from Vettori, little bit of drift in, Clarke again taps to short extra cover
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run looped towards leg stump, plenty of air, Clarke comes out to meet it and works one wide of mid-on
Henry to Clarke, no run trundles in and whirs a full-length delivery on off stump, Clarke punches it back
Henry to Clarke, no run length delivery, gets across and covers up his stumps in defence
Henry to Clarke, 1 run not quite full enough to drive outside off, Clarke chops it into the ground and squeezes a single through point
Henry to Smith, no run short and rising past Smith's beak outside off, he leans back out of the way
Henry to Smith, 1 run straighter line and Smith tucks into his favourite scoring shot, glancing a length ball behind square - 100 up for Australia
Henry to Clarke, no run slightly short and Clarke short-arms a pull towards mid-on, in the air for a bit and cut off on the bounce
Vettori to Smith, no run flighted outside off, Smith winds up for a big hit, clubs it into the covers where a diving man cuts it off
Vettori to Smith, 1 run pushed through a little quicker outside off, waits for it and pushes in front of square
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run chipped down the ground, Clarke on the walk, there's a man at long-on but it lands well in front of him
Vettori to Smith, 1 run comes forward and tickles one more down the ground
Vettori to Clarke, no run tossed up outside off and driven along the ground to the extra cover fielder
Vettori to Clarke, no run outside off, tossed up quite high, leans into a punch that again finds cover
Henry to Smith, 1 run back of a length and pulled from off stump down to fine leg

Henry to Clarke, 3 runs slightly short again, pinged off the back foot through the covers and it looked like fourth boundary for Clarke, his first in front of square... but B-Mac hunts it down and dives to pull it in inches from the rope
Henry to Smith, 1 run continues to drop short, paddled away for another single to Smith
Henry to Clarke, no run in the corridor, Clarke punches to the edge of the ring
Henry to Clarke, no run similar line, slightly full and Clarke drives, can't get it through the infield again
Henry to Clarke, FOUR runs if you can't go through 'em, try over 'em... full and straight and lofted authoritatively down the ground by Clarke, bottom-handed scoop to long-on for four
Anderson to Smith, 1 wide over the wicket, dug in very short and there are hoots from the crowd as wide is called
Anderson to Smith, 1 run shortish and dabbed off the pads towards midwicket, they hustle one more
Anderson to Clarke, 3 runs pitched up in the channel, leans into a drive and it's briefly aerial but wide of short extra cover, cut off out in the deep
Anderson to Smith, no run goes across his stumps and defends a length ball back down the pitch
Anderson to Smith, 2 runs angled on middle and off stump, tucked away into a pocket behind square and Smith hurries back for a second
Anderson to Smith, no run full, floaty wide yorker, Smith has to reach for it and McCullum cuts off the drive in the covers
Anderson to Smith, no run tight line outside off, teasing length from Anderson but Smith calmly raises his bat out of the way
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run pushed through outside off, Clarke drops back and chops through backward point
Vettori to Smith, 1 run waits in the crease and steers another single through square
Vettori to Clarke, no run tossed up, comes forward and plays along the ground to extra cover
Vettori to Clarke, 2 runs flatter and worked off the pads through midwicket for a couple - Clarke overtakes Smith
Vettori to Clarke, SIX runs six, lofted over long-off, Clarke is writing a nice little script for himself here... Skipped out and timed the ball down the ground, no slogging required
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run flat trajectory, around off stump, cut away for one more to the tally
Boult to Clarke, no run around the wicket, back of a length, steered into the covers
Boult to Clarke, no run slightly short and outside off, Clarke frees the arms but mistimes a cut into the ground, shakes his head
Boult to Clarke, no run fuller, in the channel, punched to the short extra cover fielder
Boult to Clarke, no run full again, enticing the drive, flies past the edge as Clarke has a go... looked for a moment like he'd nicked it, but no
Boult to Clarke, no run gets across his stumps and defends into the off side

Boult to Clarke, FOUR runs spanked! Touch full from Boult and Clarke stamps his mark on the final ball of the over, rattling a crisp on drive down the ground. It went at a catchable height but was closer to causing Richard Kettleborough a mischief than giving Boult a second wicket
Vettori to Smith, 1 run tossed up, comes forward and pushes to long-on
Vettori to Clarke, 2 runs busy in the crease now, moves across and whips a couple through square leg

Vettori to Clarke, 1 run tossed up and flicked off the pads for one more - that's Clarke's half-century, to the delight of the MCG. Started a bit sketchily but has shown class. Quick raise of the bat, then on we go, there's a job to do
Vettori to Smith, 1 run driven in the air but short of mid-off diving forwards! Very difficult chance, couldn't get his hands under it
Vettori to Clarke, no run flat outside off, goes back and taps into the covers
Vettori to Clarke, no run pushed through in the channel again, chopped in front of square
Boult to Smith, no run Boult goes around the wicket, shortish and coming back in at the batsman, who defends square
Boult to Smith, 1 run back and across, back and across, back and across.. Smith nurdles one more to leg. Nurdling on into the sunset
Boult to Clarke, no run short of a length and played the top of the bounce over off stump, down in front of point
Boult to Clarke, no run quick, well-directed bumper, Clarke crouches as the ball flies over his back
Boult to Clarke, no run back of a length and defended on the back foot around off stump
Boult to Clarke, no run goes over the wicket, pitches on a length and raps Clarke on the knee roll, pitched outside leg, I think, runs away to backward point
Southee to Smith, 2 runs back of a length outside off, hangs in the crease and chops a couple through point
Southee to Smith, FOUR runs short and wide and slashed fine of third man for four. Thick outside edge but Smith knew where it was headed, well wide of the lone slip
Southee to Smith, 2 runs on the stumps, Smith goes across and miscues a pull through backward square for a couple
Southee to Smith, no run good length in the channel outside off, steps out and shoulders arms
Southee to Smith, 1 run full toss from Southee, veering towards leg stump, clipped away through square for one more
Southee to Clarke, 2 runs full toss again, maybe a slower one, Clarke doesn't time a bunt over mid-off but gets a couple
Boult to Smith, no run pitched up outside off, punched into the covers
Boult to Smith, 1 run in the channel outside off, drops back and steers one through backward point
Boult to Clarke, no run fullish outside off, tapped towards short extra cover
Boult to Clarke, FOUR runs lets go a fraction early and the attempted yorker becomes a full toss, Clarke leans out and casually slaps four through the covers
Boult to Clarke, 1 run in the channel, fullish length, Clarke sits back and squeezes one more behind square
Boult to Smith, no run back over the wicket, fires in another attempted yorker, this one is on target and Smith nearly gets a leading edge back to the bowler. Not quite, though
Southee to Clarke, FOUR runs full and straight, in the slot and Clarke carts it over wide long-on... well, not quite over, plenty of bottom-handed muscle in that but it bounces short of the rope
Southee to Clarke, FOUR runs four more, low full toss whacked through the covers, zips past the man at short extra
Southee to Clarke, FOUR runs length outside off, four more, sliced past point, flowing front-foot square drive from Clarke, he's charging towards the cup
Southee to Clarke, FOUR runs four more, that's four in a row! Short and wide this time and Clarke dismissively rifles a cut away, it's all coming in a rush, six weeks of tension ebbing away
Southee to Clarke, 1 run bangs this in short, sits back ready for it, paddles a single around the corner
Southee to Smith, no run fullish, outside off, Smith comes out to meet it but spanks a drive straight to mid-off
Henry to Clarke, 1 wide starts with a back-of-the-hand slower ball, drifts down the leg side
Henry to Watson, no run drops back and defends a short-of-a-length delivery on the stumps
Henry to Watson, 1 run short again, drops deep and pulls one away through square
Henry to Smith, 2 runs on the stumps, Smith whips a couple more past midwicket
Henry to Smith, 2 runs fullish outside off, steers this behind point for two that takes him past fifty for the fifth time in the tournament. Smiffy's World Cup? Or Starc's?
Henry to Smith, no run goes across and defends on off stump
Southee to Watson, no run length ball around the line of off, Watson comes across and blocks lugubriously
Southee to Watson, no run continues to angled in from the channel, played to the leg side off his body
Southee to Watson, 1 run pitched up and driven wide of mid-on, there's a direct hit but Watson was safe
Southee to Smith, no run full length, almost the leg-stump yorker and Smith is defeated walking to the off side, slips narrowly past the wicket
Southee to Smith, no run excellent yorker from Southee, right on middle and off, Smith drops the bat on it in time
Southee to Smith, 1 run full again, dug out back past the bowler, mid-on busts a gut to get there and cuts it off, keep them to a single. Still two more required

Henry to Smith, FOUR runs short and pulled away with a whirl of those rubber wrists! There she blows, the winning runs fittingly from Smith's bat - Australia win the World Cup final by seven wickets, New Zealand were just swept aside in the end. Smith has been one of Australia's leading lights and he had guided them home at the G

Australia will be receiving the trophy shortly, their fifth World Cup. Two years ago, they were being whitewashed in India and going out of the Champions Trophy without a win. Lehmann has helped recapture their mojo, they'll certainly celebrate under the southern cross tonight. And at the end of the Australian summer, after the pain of Phillip Hughes' passing in November, this will also be a cathartic triumph.

The final, in the end, was something of a waltz but we'll not forget Baz and his Black Caps charging through the competiton with an aggressive approach that will forever leave its mark. The G got the result it wanted, however. We'll have plenty of reaction, appreciation and analysis coming up on the site, so stick around. It's been a pleasure and a privilege to bring you the action, we'll be back again in four years' time (possibly before then, too). From Sid and myself and all the guys and girls in New Zealand and Australia, India, England and the US, thanks for joining in and see you again

We've had a blast, haven't we? The batsmen certainly did, though the Man of the Final and Man of the Tournament were bowlers. We will remember spells from Mitchell Starc and Trent Boult, Tim Southee and Wahab Riaz for as long as we do those innings of fury from Martin Guptill, AB de Villiers and Glenn Maxwell. Not to mention the contributions made from all across the cricketing world, from Shaiman Anwar and William Porterfield, Shapoor Zadran and Sean Williams.
Australia won by 7 wickets (with 101 balls remaining)
Player of the match is James Faulkner, AUS
